Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I'm in the process of a mod that will create numerous cities around Kerbin.

Update!:

Added/Adding Lighting mechanism...

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Added new texture system, but I will be re-developing it as it wasn't very well thought out.

I fixed the colider: the Game object layer must be 17 to work with kerbals.

I change the hight calculator to be based off the size of the building footprint. Still a bit on the tall side I think.

Next up: Textures and emissive materials for night time!

It is KerbTown independent, and should be pretty speedy, with lots of interesting geometries and such.

However! I am a programmer, not a modeling artist, and I barely whipped out the textures in GIMP. If anyone has sources of or good textures for roofs, windows, vents, building objects, etc, PLEASE post some links here.

Edited September 29, 2013 by rbray89
What functionality do the buildings have? Or just eye-candy?

What functionality do the buildings have? Or just eye-candy?

The buildings will have collision meshes, and as long as I can figure out how to use appropriate shaders/textures, the cities will be lit at night.

"It is KerbTown independent"

This means your not using KerbTown?

"It is KerbTown independent"

This means your not using KerbTown?

I would imagine that this is a yes, it doesn't use KerbTown.

The most awesome city generator is from Introversion.

They started to make a game but they lost focus and could not make a real game.

But the city generation is awesome and inspiring.

If we could get something like this for KSP everyone could setup his own citys on planets and muns, with an interplanetary airport to bring the resource to build it..

"It is KerbTown independent"

This means your not using KerbTown?

Correct. It didn't load things quite how I needed them to be loaded, and I wanted everything to be generated in-game.

The most awesome city generator is from Introversion.

They started to make a game but they lost focus and could not make a real game.

But the city generation is awesome and inspiring.

If we could get something like this for KSP everyone could setup his own citys on planets and muns, with an interplanetary airport to bring the resource to build it..

I saw that, and I also saw the Kerbin City community project, and that is actually what prompted me to work on this. I hope to have something similar by the time I am done.
This looks promising. It can make a good surrounding filler for the kerbin city too if you can use both mods at the same time.

Interesting. May I suggest that your procedural city generator also account for outlying suburbs, farms, industrial districts etc? While the Introversion tech demo (which I presume is what you're aiming for) does a nice job of generating high rise buildings and semi-realistic roads, real-life cities aren't 100% skyscrapers or business buildings.

However! I am a programmer, not a modeling artist, and I barely whipped out the textures in GIMP. If anyone has sources of or good textures for roofs, windows, vents, building objects, etc, PLEASE post some links here.

Try this site, I used to use it when I was making paper models of buildings in Gimp.

You have to register to get larger textures, but the basic membership is free.

http://www.cgtextures.com/

Edited September 16, 2013 by Tommygun
Wow tommygun, thanks for that link . Now i can make better looking cities

Try this site, I use to use it when I was making paper models of buildings in Gimp.

You have to register to get larger textures, but the basic membership is free.

http://www.cgtextures.com/

YES! this is exactly the kind of thing I was looking for. Thanks!

Interesting. May I suggest that your procedural city generator also account for outlying suburbs, farms, industrial districts etc? While the Introversion tech demo (which I presume is what you're aiming for) does a nice job of generating high rise buildings and semi-realistic roads, real-life cities aren't 100% skyscrapers or business buildings.

Yeah, the plan was to add additional non-procedural models/sprites to roads (traffic lights, trash bins, bus stops, etc) along with empty lots, construction lots, parking lots, parks, etc.

I have some ideas about generating suburbs/farms, but nothing concrete at the moment.

Looking good so far! Would be awesome to see buildings other than skyscrapers though (I think this has been mentioned already), and also actual roads and stuff between the buildings would be really neat.

Also, ever consider having it generate like doors on the buildings (Just for show of course), or AC units on the roof?

Looking good so far! Would be awesome to see buildings other than skyscrapers though (I think this has been mentioned already), and also actual roads and stuff between the buildings would be really neat.

Also, ever consider having it generate like doors on the buildings (Just for show of course), or AC units on the roof?

Yeah, these items will be coming. I want to generate other types of buildings and enhance the current appearance of the "office block" style.
I will also be calling for building texture sets that people want to be used. The more variety in appearance, the better!

First, let me say that I like this, I like this. Very nice work.

I do have a suggestion to make, and a possible solution to go with it Right now, most, or all, of the city adding mods I have seen have made dense, square sections of city. Perfect if they are a part of the city, but not if they are the population center. There would be outlying areas, less population and building-dense areas, etc. What I would offer as a possible solution, if you are using random number generation to determine the height (influenced by the surrounding area, distance from center, etc) would be to add a value for an empty plot of land, or a park, or... you get the idea So in the center of the city, there would be no chance of this item coming up, but as you move further and further away from city center, the likelihood of single-family homes with larger yards, city parks, fields, etc, becomes more and more possible.

Also one other idea, as you mentioned the idea of farms and "support" stuff outside of a city. Perhaps a flag for "Population Center Type". A couple example possibilities could be "Urban City" "Rural Town" "Support Industries". So the Urban city gets you your massive skyscrapers, the rural town gets you a few houses with large fields, and support industries could make power stations, factories, etc, etc.

Again, please dont confuse the suggestions for a "I dont like this" statement. Quite the opposite! Keep up the great work!

This thread remind me of this article.. Take a look, it could help you.

http://www.shamusyoung.com/twentysidedtale/?p=2940

https://code.google.com/p/pixelcity/

Sorry for my bad English
Pretty cool. If something like this is implemented properly it could add another whole dimension to KSP. I much prefer this approach to Kerbtown.

The thing i didn't like about kerbtown is that nobody ever released anything for it, but i am happy to see this being in the works. Looking awesome man. Though, i have downloaded this before, but am unable to find the the page where i downloaded it. Has it been taken down or something?

The thing i didn't like about kerbtown is that nobody ever released anything for it, but i am happy to see this being in the works. Looking awesome man. Though, i have downloaded this before, but am unable to find the the page where i downloaded it. Has it been taken down or something?

No, I never got around to creating a release. I started work on another mod first. I'll come back to this if I can figure out a way to create it without melting computers. The mod I'm working on is in my sig.

No, I never got around to creating a release. I started work on another mod first. I'll come back to this if I can figure out a way to create it without melting computers. The mod I'm working on is in my sig.

Huh, interesting. Coulda sworn i downloaded it.(and yes i do love your clouds and city lights mod.)
so the city is always going to be next to the runway
I would imagine no. Since it's procedural, it could pop up anywhere. Probably a good idea to use an elevation limit so there aren't skyscrapers sticking out of the mountains / oceans.
